html.p: An application whitelist only allows selected software applications to run on computers. This page provides details into Application Whitelisting controls in your environment. Providing visualisations related to counts of allowed, blocked and audit application whitelisting events by user. In addition, the bottom two panels will show details in relation to executables and users that were blocked or allowed to run due to audit mode.

When reviewing this dashboard you should pay attention to trends in application whitelisting blocked execution and audit execution trends. Of importance are the following conditions
Application Whitelisting audit events, audit events are shown when a process is executed on a host that does not have application whitelisting rules enforced.
Administrators executing applications that should have been prevented by policy.
Risky application execution, i.e cmd.exe, powershell.exe, net.exe etc

search.query: | pivot Application_Whitelisting Application_Whitelisting_Allow count(Application_Whitelisting_Allow) AS "Count of Application Whitelisting Allow" SPLITROW _time AS _time PERIOD auto SPLITCOL user SORT 10 _time ROWSUMMARY 0 COLSUMMARY 0 NUMCOLS 10 SHOWOTHER 0

| pivot Application_Whitelisting Application_Whitelisting_Block count(Application_Whitelisting_Block) AS "Count of Application Whitelisting Block" SPLITROW _time AS _time PERIOD auto SPLITCOL user SORT 100 _time ROWSUMMARY 0 COLSUMMARY 0 NUMCOLS 10 SHOWOTHER 1

| pivot Application_Whitelisting Application_Whitelisting_Audit count(Application_Whitelisting_Audit) AS "Count of Application Whitelisting Audit" SPLITROW _time AS _time PERIOD auto SPLITCOL user SORT 100 _time ROWSUMMARY 0 COLSUMMARY 0 NUMCOLS 10 SHOWOTHER 1

| datamodel Application_Whitelisting Application_Whitelisting_Block search | stats values(Application_Whitelisting.file_path) as "File Path" by Application_Whitelisting.user | rename Application_Whitelisting.user as User

| datamodel Application_Whitelisting Application_Whitelisting_Audit search | stats values(Application_Whitelisting.file_path) as "File Path" by Application_Whitelisting.user | rename Application_Whitelisting.user as User

panel.title: Example data sources to power this dashboard

ul.li: Application Whitelisting Data - Microsoft Applocker, Symantec Endpoint Protection, Airlock Digital, Heat Application Control. These sources must log Allows, Blocks and Audit to provide accurate data
Assett Inventory Data - Microsoft Active Directory, CMDB, SCCM. These sources must log the hostnames to allow comparison to Application Whitelisting Data.
